overview: Amir Shapiro received the B.Sc., M.Sc., and Ph.D. degrees in Mechanical Engineering from the Technion, Israel Institute of Technology, Haifa, in 1997, 2000, and 2004 respectively. Currently he is a Lecturer with the Department of Mechanical Engineering at Ben-Gurion University of the Negev, Beer-Sheva, Israel. On 2005-2006 he was a post doctoral fellow at the Robotics Institute of Carnegie Mellon University, Pittsburgh, PA. His interests include locomotion of multi-limbed mechanisms in unstructured complex environments, navigation algorithms for multi-limbed robots, robot grasping design, control, and stability analysis, climbing robots, snake like robots, and multi-robot on-line motion planning.
